column4: Is there a way to pop in an empty hdd then migrate the installed ubuntu from the other hdd to the empty?
i would boot from live cd then rsync the old install to new hdd
right click on the image file -> properties -> Open with
select gthumb there
I did it, but right clicking is not the way I want to view images
after you select the right open with action,  you can just double click
won't work at all it still uses eog
how did you select application in Open With?
trying to translate, right click on a png -> open with -> other application -> choose feh or gthumb from the list, check the widget to remember settings for png files
make sure you have really selected the app you want (a dot in the circle)
not just make the app appear in the list nor click on the name
like that http://ompldr.org/vNWt6OA/Screenshot-133.png
my window looks totally different dude, no tabs at all and no circles or add-remove buttons :-(
are you using GNOME ...
yes
my png settings http://ompldr.org/vNWt6OQ
you are doing  Right click -> Open With  instead of  Right click -> properties -> open with
Properties should be the menu entry at the bottom when you right click
*facepalm*
ok I got it.
you may need to do that for different image format at first
it is highly messed up, users first see the open with menu, and there is the option to link filetypes with apps
